title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Life Expectancy and Population
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and population using data from the Gapminder dataset. The scatter plot below illustrates how these two variables are related across countries.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


data = pd.read_csv('gapminder.csv')


plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(data['population_millions'], data['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.7)
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs Population')
plt.xlabel('Population')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using data from the Gapminder dataset. The scatter plot below illustrates how these two variables are related across countries.

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd


data = pd.read_csv('/Users/joyasushibun/Documents/QTM 350/gapminder.csv')


plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.scatter(data['gdp_per_capita'], data['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.7)
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita')
plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: Country Analysis: Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population
text:
Country Analysis: Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population
This page analyzes changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country over time. In this example, we will focus on the “United States” using data from the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt


data = pd.read_csv('/Users/joyasushibun/Documents/QTM 350/gapminder.csv')


country_name = "United States"
country_data = data[data['country'] == country_name]


plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))


plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['life_expectancy'], label="Life Expectancy", marker='o')


plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['gdp_per_capita'], label="GDP per Capita", marker='o')


plt.plot(country_data['year'], country_data['population_millions'], label="Population", marker='o')


plt.title(f'Changes in Life Expectancy, GDP per Capita, and Population in {country_name} Over Time')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Values')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

title: William’s website
text:
Dataset Information
The Gapminder dataset is widely used to analyze trends in global development. The dataset provides insights into the changes in life expectancy, population, and GDP per capita.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita using data from the Gapminder dataset. The scatter plot below illustrates how these two variables are related across countries.


Import necessary libraries
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import pandas as pd


Load the dataset
data = pd.read_csv(‘gapminder.csv’)


Create the scatter plot
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6)) plt.scatter(data[‘gdp_per_capita’], data[‘life_expectancy’], alpha=0.7) plt.title(‘Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita’) plt.xlabel(‘GDP per Capita’) plt.ylabel(‘Life Expectancy’) plt.grid(True) plt.show()
